intro: Coelocarpum glandulosum, commonly known as the glandular coelocarpum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, glandular leaves and clusters of tiny, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or shrublands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
